medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain started yesterday, initially colicky in nature in the lower left back, radiating to the abdomen, becoming more diffuse and anterior while in the ED. Described as sharp and shooting, with associated nausea and vomiting. Denies finding a comfortable position. Duration: Days. No fevers, chills, or diarrhea.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Notable for bilateral femoral enchondromas, with a previous resection of one in the right femur. Recently had varicose vein removal from her left leg. Previous emergency department visit for headache and facial numbness attributed to contrast reaction. Negative past medical history for hypertension, diabetes, heart problems, and lung problems.
medical_history.family_history: Notable for mother with pulmonary hypertension; otherwise negative. No history of bone tumors or soft tissue masses.
